title: 중급 회화 상황 표현
description: 실생활 상황별 복합 표현과 자연스러운 의사소통 능력 구축

key_changes: Bridge 스테이지 추가로 고급 표현 조기 도입

randomization_system.description: 상황별 맥락을 유지하면서 다양한 표현 패턴으로 15개 문장 생성
randomization_system.pattern_consistency: 상황 맥락 내에서 복합 문법 구조 자연스럽게 연습
randomization_system.vocabulary_variation: 상황별 핵심 어휘 + 개인차 반영 어휘 혼합
randomization_system.context_similarity: 실제 상황에서 발생하는 연속적 대화 패턴

phases.title: 개인 이야기와 경험 공유
phases.description: 과거/현재/미래 경험을 자연스럽게 연결하여 풍부한 개인 서사 구축

phases.title: 계획과 추측 표현
phases.description: 미래 계획, 조건부 상황, 추측을 통한 의사결정 대화

phases.title: 설명과 묘사 심화
phases.description: 복잡한 대상과 상황을 관계절과 연결어구로 정확하게 설명

phases.title: 의견과 논리 표현
phases.description: 근거있는 의견 제시와 논리적 사고 과정의 언어화

phases.title: 사회적 상호작용
phases.description: 조언, 부탁, 동의/반대 등 타인과의 원활한 의사소통

phases.title: 뉘앙스와 강조 표현
phases.description: 감정과 의도를 섬세하게 전달하는 고급 표현력

stages.title: 개인 경험 소개 (현재완료 경험)
stages.situation_context: 새로운 사람들과 자신의 경험을 공유하는 상황

experience_inquiry.en: Have you ever been to Japan?
Have you ever tried Korean food?
Have you ever learned a musical instrument?

sharing_experiences.en: I've been to Europe several times
I've lived in three different cities
I've learned guitar for two years
I've worked in customer service before

experience_evaluation.en: It was quite challenging but rewarding
It was one of the best decisions I made
experience_evaluation.ko: 내가 내린 최고의 결정 중 하나였어

experience_evaluation.en: It was different from what I expected

stages.title: 최근 활동과 변화 (현재완료 계속)
stages.situation_context: 최근 생활의 변화나 지속적인 활동에 대해 이야기하는 상황

continuous_activities.en: I've been learning Spanish for six months
I've been working at this company since 2022
We've been living together for three years
I've been exercising regularly since January
She's been studying for her exam all week
continuous_activities.ko: 그녀는 일주일 내내 시험공부를 하고 있어

changes_over_time.en: Things have changed a lot since I moved here
My English has improved since I started this course
changes_over_time.ko: 이 과정을 시작한 이후로 영어가 늘었어

changes_over_time.en: The city has grown rapidly since 2020
Technology has advanced since we were kids
My perspective has changed since traveling

recent_states.en: I've been feeling more confident recently
I've been quite tired this week
I've been more focused on my goals
I've been enjoying my new hobby

stages.title: 과거 에피소드 상세 설명 (과거완료)
stages.situation_context: 특별한 과거 사건을 시간순으로 상세히 설명하는 상황

sequence_clarity.en: When I arrived, the meeting had already started
sequence_clarity.ko: 내가 도착했을 때 회의는 이미 시작됐었어

sequence_clarity.en: Before I graduated, I had found a job
When she called, I had just finished dinner
sequence_clarity.ko: 그녀가 전화했을 때 나는 막 저녁을 끝냈었어

sequence_clarity.en: Before the rain started, we had reached home
sequence_clarity.ko: 비가 시작하기 전에 우리는 집에 도착했었어

sequence_clarity.en: When I woke up, my roommate had already left
sequence_clarity.ko: 내가 일어났을 때 룸메이트는 이미 떠났었어

background_context.en: I had studied French before moving to Paris
She had worked there before starting her own business
background_context.ko: 자신의 사업을 시작하기 전에 그곳에서 일했었어

background_context.en: We had discussed this before making the decision
I had visited the place before recommending it
They had practiced together before the performance

resultative_past.en: After I had saved enough money, I bought a car
resultative_past.ko: 충분한 돈을 모은 후에 차를 샀어

resultative_past.en: After we had finished the project, we celebrated
After she had recovered, she went back to work
After they had moved, they felt more comfortable
After I had learned the truth, everything made sense
resultative_past.ko: 진실을 안 후에 모든 것이 이해됐어

stages.title: 수동태로 객관적 설명하기
stages.situation_context: 공식적이거나 객관적인 정보를 전달하는 상황

factual_description.en: This building was designed by a famous architect
factual_description.ko: 이 건물은 유명한 건축가에 의해 설계됐어

factual_description.en: The book was written by my favorite author
factual_description.ko: 그 책은 내가 좋아하는 작가에 의해 쓰여졌어

factual_description.en: This problem will be solved by our team
factual_description.ko: 이 문제는 우리 팀에 의해 해결될 거야

factual_description.en: The movie was directed by Steven Spielberg
These products are made in Korea

process_description.en: The documents will be reviewed next week
The results will be announced tomorrow
Changes are being made to improve the system
process_description.ko: 시스템 개선을 위해 변경사항들이 만들어지고 있어

process_description.en: The project was completed ahead of schedule

established_facts.en: It has been proven that exercise is important
It has been decided that we'll meet monthly
It has been suggested that we change our approach
It has been confirmed that the event is cancelled
It has been reported that sales increased

stages.title: 미래 계획과 의도 (will vs going to)
stages.situation_context: 미래 계획을 구체적으로 설명하고 의도를 명확히 하는 상황

planned_intentions.en: I'm going to start my own business next year
We're going to move to a bigger apartment
She's going to study abroad for a year
They're going to travel around Europe
I'm going to learn a new skill this summer
planned_intentions.ko: 이번 여름에 새로운 기술을 배울 예정이야

spontaneous_decisions.en: I'll help you with that project
We'll meet you at the restaurant
I'll call you when I get home
She'll pick up the kids from school

predictions.en: I think it's going to be a successful project
The weather is going to be nice this weekend
predictions.ko: 이번 주말 날씨가 좋을 것 같아

predictions.en: This technology is going to change everything
predictions.ko: 이 기술이 모든 것을 바꿀 것 같아

predictions.en: Traffic is going to be heavy during rush hour
The meeting is going to run longer than expected

stages.title: 고급 조동사 활용 (could, might, would)
stages.situation_context: 정중하고 완곡한 표현으로 의사소통하는 상황

polite_suggestions.en: I could help you with your presentation
We could meet earlier if that works better
polite_suggestions.ko: 그게 더 좋다면 더 일찍 만날 수 있어요

polite_suggestions.en: You could try a different approach
We could postpone the meeting if necessary
I could send you the information later

expressing_possibility.en: She might not be able to come
The project might take longer than expected
This might be the solution we need

polite_requests.en: Would you mind checking this document?
Would you be able to attend the meeting?
Would you like me to explain it again?
Would you prefer to meet in the morning?
Would it be possible to extend the deadline?

stages.title: 조건문으로 상황 설정하기 (1형식)
stages.situation_context: 실현 가능한 조건과 결과를 논의하는 상황

realistic_conditions.en: If the weather is nice, we'll have a picnic
If you study hard, you'll pass the exam
If we leave early, we'll avoid traffic
realistic_conditions.ko: 일찍 떠나면 교통체증을 피할 수 있을 거야

realistic_conditions.en: If she agrees, we'll start the project
If the price is reasonable, I'll buy it

negative_conditions.en: Unless you hurry, you'll be late
Unless we act now, we'll miss the opportunity
negative_conditions.ko: 지금 행동하지 않으면 기회를 놓칠 거야

negative_conditions.en: Unless it rains, we'll go hiking
negative_conditions.ko: 비가 오지 않으면 하이킹을 갈 거야

negative_conditions.en: Unless you ask, you won't know
negative_conditions.ko: 물어보지 않으면 알 수 없을 거야

negative_conditions.en: Unless we book early, we won't get good seats
negative_conditions.ko: 일찍 예약하지 않으면 좋은 자리를 얻지 못할 거야

time_conditions.en: When I finish work, I'll call you
When the meeting ends, we'll discuss the results
When you arrive, we'll start dinner
When she gets back, we'll make the decision
When the weather improves, we'll go out

stages.title: 가정과 조언 (2형식 조건문)
stages.situation_context: 가상의 상황을 가정하여 조언하거나 의견을 제시하는 상황
key_patterns: If I were you, I would + [동사원형]

giving_advice.en: If I were you, I would take that job offer
giving_advice.ko: 내가 너라면 그 일자리 제안을 받을 거야

giving_advice.en: If I were you, I would apologize immediately
If I were you, I would think about it more carefully
giving_advice.ko: 내가 너라면 더 신중히 생각할 거야

giving_advice.en: If I were you, I would ask for help
If I were you, I would start planning early
giving_advice.ko: 내가 너라면 일찍 계획을 세울 거야

hypothetical_situations.en: If I had more time, I would travel more
hypothetical_situations.ko: 시간이 더 있다면 여행을 더 할 텐데

hypothetical_situations.en: If we had more money, we would buy a bigger house
hypothetical_situations.ko: 돈이 더 있다면 더 큰 집을 살 텐데

hypothetical_situations.en: If she lived closer, we would meet more often
hypothetical_situations.ko: 그녀가 더 가까이 산다면 더 자주 만날 텐데

hypothetical_situations.en: If the weather were better, we would go out
If I knew the answer, I would tell you

wishful_thinking.en: I wish I could speak more languages
wishful_thinking.ko: 더 많은 언어를 할 수 있으면 좋겠어

wishful_thinking.en: I wish I had more free time
I wish the weather were nicer
I wish we could meet more often
wishful_thinking.ko: 더 자주 만날 수 있으면 좋겠어

stages.title: 사람과 사물 상세 묘사 (관계대명사)
stages.situation_context: 특정한 사람이나 사물을 정확하게 구분하여 설명하는 상황

identifying_people.en: The person who called you is my colleague
The woman who lives next door is a teacher
The student who asked the question is very smart
The man who helped us yesterday was very kind
identifying_people.ko: 어제 우리를 도와준 남자는 매우 친절했어

identifying_people.en: The person who designed this building is famous

describing_objects.en: The book that I recommended is really good
The movie we watched last night was amazing
The restaurant that serves Italian food is expensive
The phone I bought yesterday doesn't work
The place where we met is special to me

providing_details.en: This is the school where I studied
That was the day when everything changed
I understand the reason why you're upset
This is the way how we solve problems
That's the time when I was happiest

stages.title: 간접 전달 (간접화법)
stages.situation_context: 다른 사람의 말이나 생각을 전달하는 상황

reporting_statements.en: He said that he was very busy
She told me that she would call later
They mentioned that the meeting was cancelled
My boss said that we needed to work harder
reporting_statements.ko: 상사는 우리가 더 열심히 일해야 한다고 말했어

reporting_statements.en: The teacher explained that the test was difficult

reporting_questions.en: She asked if I was ready
He asked whether we could meet tomorrow
reporting_questions.ko: 그는 우리가 내일 만날 수 있는지 물어봤어

reporting_questions.en: They asked if the store was open
She asked whether I had finished the work
He asked if we needed any help

reporting_wh_questions.en: She asked what I was doing
reporting_wh_questions.ko: 그녀는 내가 뭘 하고 있는지 물어봤어

reporting_wh_questions.en: He asked where we were going
They asked when the project would be finished
She asked how I knew the answer
reporting_wh_questions.ko: 그녀는 내가 어떻게 답을 알았는지 물어봤어

reporting_wh_questions.en: He asked why we were late

stages.title: 정중한 간접 질문 (I wonder if)
stages.situation_context: 직접적이지 않게 정보를 얻거나 확인하는 상황
key_patterns: Could you tell me + [의문사 + 평서문 어순]?

wondering_statements.en: I wonder if she'll come to the party
I wonder if the weather will be nice tomorrow
I wonder if this is the right decision
I wonder if we have enough time
I wonder if they know about this

polite_information_requests.en: Could you tell me where the nearest station is?
polite_information_requests.ko: 가장 가까운 역이 어디인지 알려주실 수 있나요?

polite_information_requests.en: Could you tell me what time the store closes?
polite_information_requests.ko: 가게가 몇 시에 문을 닫는지 알려주실 수 있나요?

polite_information_requests.en: Could you tell me how much this costs?
Could you tell me when the meeting starts?
polite_information_requests.ko: 회의가 언제 시작하는지 알려주실 수 있나요?

polite_information_requests.en: Could you tell me why the system isn't working?
polite_information_requests.ko: 시스템이 왜 작동하지 않는지 알려주실 수 있나요?

checking_knowledge.en: Do you know where she went?
Do you know what he said?
Do you know when they'll arrive?
Do you know how to fix this?
Do you know why she's upset?

stages.title: 복잡한 설명과 묘사
stages.situation_context: 여러 세부사항을 포함한 복잡한 정보를 체계적으로 설명하는 상황
key_patterns: On one hand, + [A]. On the other hand, + [B]

step_by_step_explanation.en: First, you need to register. Then, you pay the fee. Finally, you can start
step_by_step_explanation.ko: 먼저 등록해야 해. 그다음 수수료를 내는 거야. 마지막으로 시작할 수 있어

step_by_step_explanation.en: First, we analyze the problem. Then, we find solutions. Finally, we implement them
step_by_step_explanation.ko: 먼저 문제를 분석해. 그다음 해결책을 찾는 거야. 마지막으로 실행해

step_by_step_explanation.en: First, heat the pan. Then, add oil. Finally, cook the vegetables
step_by_step_explanation.ko: 먼저 팬을 달궈. 그다음 기름을 넣는 거야. 마지막으로 야채를 요리해

step_by_step_explanation.en: First, save your work. Then, close the program. Finally, restart the computer
step_by_step_explanation.ko: 먼저 작업을 저장해. 그다음 프로그램을 닫는 거야. 마지막으로 컴퓨터를 재시작해

step_by_step_explanation.en: First, we meet the client. Then, we discuss requirements. Finally, we create a proposal
step_by_step_explanation.ko: 먼저 고객을 만나. 그다음 요구사항을 논의해. 마지막으로 제안서를 만들어

comprehensive_descriptions.en: Not only is it expensive, but it's also difficult to use
Not only did she study hard, but she also helped others
comprehensive_descriptions.ko: 그녀는 열심히 공부했을 뿐만 아니라 다른 사람들도 도왔어

comprehensive_descriptions.en: Not only is the food delicious, but the service is excellent
comprehensive_descriptions.ko: 음식이 맛있을 뿐만 아니라 서비스도 훌륭해

comprehensive_descriptions.en: Not only did we finish early, but we also saved money
comprehensive_descriptions.ko: 일찍 끝냈을 뿐만 아니라 돈도 절약했어

comprehensive_descriptions.en: Not only is she talented, but she's also very hardworking
comprehensive_descriptions.ko: 그녀는 재능이 있을 뿐만 아니라 매우 성실해

balanced_perspectives.en: On one hand, it's convenient. On the other hand, it's expensive
On one hand, remote work saves time. On the other hand, it can be isolating
balanced_perspectives.ko: 한편으로는 재택근무가 시간을 절약해. 다른 한편으로는 고립될 수 있어

balanced_perspectives.en: On one hand, technology helps us. On the other hand, we become dependent
balanced_perspectives.ko: 한편으로는 기술이 우리를 도와. 다른 한편으로는 의존하게 돼

balanced_perspectives.en: On one hand, the job pays well. On the other hand, the hours are long
balanced_perspectives.ko: 한편으로는 급여가 좋아. 다른 한편으로는 근무시간이 길어

balanced_perspectives.en: On one hand, the city is exciting. On the other hand, it's quite noisy
balanced_perspectives.ko: 한편으로는 도시가 흥미로워. 다른 한편으로는 꽤 시끄러워

stages.title: 원인과 결과 연결하기
stages.situation_context: 사건의 원인을 분석하고 결과를 설명하는 상황

cause_and_effect.en: Because of the heavy rain, the game was cancelled
Because of her hard work, she got promoted
Because of the traffic, we arrived late
Because of the pandemic, many events were postponed
Because of the new policy, costs have decreased

results_and_consequences.en: As a result of the changes, productivity improved
As a result of studying abroad, her English improved
As a result of the merger, the company grew
As a result of the investment, profits increased
As a result of the training, skills developed

formal_causation.en: Due to technical difficulties, the website is down
Due to budget constraints, the project was scaled down
Due to his expertise, he was chosen for the position
formal_causation.ko: 그의 전문성으로 인해 그 자리에 선택됐어

formal_causation.en: Due to market conditions, sales declined
Due to safety concerns, the building was evacuated

stages.title: 의견과 신념 표현하기
stages.situation_context: 개인의 견해를 명확히 제시하고 근거를 제공하는 상황

personal_opinions.en: I think this is the best solution
I believe everyone deserves equal opportunities
personal_opinions.ko: 모든 사람이 평등한 기회를 받을 자격이 있다고 믿어

personal_opinions.en: I think we should consider other options
I believe hard work always pays off
I think technology will change our future
personal_opinions.ko: 기술이 우리의 미래를 바꿀 거라고 생각해

formal_opinions.en: In my opinion, this approach is more effective
formal_opinions.ko: 내 의견으로는 이 접근법이 더 효과적이야

formal_opinions.en: In my opinion, we need to act quickly
In my opinion, the risks are too high
In my opinion, education is the key to success
In my opinion, communication is most important

perspective_sharing.en: From my perspective, the situation is improving
From my perspective, we're on the right track
perspective_sharing.ko: 내 관점에서는 우리가 올바른 길에 있어

perspective_sharing.en: From my perspective, both sides have valid points
perspective_sharing.ko: 내 관점에서는 양쪽 다 타당한 점이 있어

perspective_sharing.en: From my perspective, timing is crucial
From my perspective, the benefits outweigh the costs

stages.title: 확신 정도 조절하기
stages.situation_context: 확실함과 불확실함의 정도를 정확히 표현하는 상황

high_certainty.en: I'm certain this is the right decision

moderate_certainty.en: I think it will probably rain

stages.title: 목적과 이유 명시하기
stages.situation_context: 행동의 목적과 이유를 명확하게 설명하는 상황

stating_purposes.en: I study hard in order to get good grades
stating_purposes.ko: 좋은 성적을 받기 위해 열심히 공부해

stating_purposes.en: We save money in order to buy a house
She exercises in order to stay healthy
They work overtime in order to meet the deadline
I take notes in order to remember everything

explaining_intentions.en: I speak slowly so that you can understand
explaining_intentions.ko: 네가 이해할 수 있도록 천천히 말해

explaining_intentions.en: We left early so that we wouldn't be late
She writes everything down so that she won't forget
They practice every day so that they can improve

showing_results.en: We invested in training. As a result, productivity increased
